Author: willofleo#7505
Content: @Markus  The DEX token dose not represent a utility of sort , it more of a representation of shares  of reward to be distributed , so you ment to say a large portion is owned by a few which seems correct however a large share is held by other funds such as supernet token which in turn is held by 100s of  holders , and then the other 50%

Author: willofleo#7505
Content: of reward  is held by MGW, BOT , jUMBLR, REV etc which is also held by 100s of holders each

Author: willofleo#7505
Content: so you  dont have to buy DEX to own shares of DEX reward , but very few are willing to sell and why should they when the potential is high , alternatives is you make you own GUI with DEX api  and earn a portion , so it not centralised like say binance coin in terms of concentrated ownership

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Evening all: a new day, new questions from me. I read in the Cryptoslate interview with CTO Stadelmann about the DEX. Interesting bits: 0 listingfee, every pair has a pair with every other listed coin, 0,15% tx fee. My question is: are those parameters embedded in the code (as well as de 1 million fee cap to be withheld first to cover costs) or are those subjects to change in the future? Further note: @jl777c i saw you only got 12 DEX coins, how i that possible as a lead engineer? I figured you "green" guys would be holding a majority of the coins in this project

Content: And other question: you guys told me earlier that the tx fee would be payed in the coin traded, but then you get fractions (for example, if you trade 50 KMD and 0,15% is taken off you end up trading 49,xx). Isnt that unpractical?

Author: mobipoi#5774
Content: Hmm thats very centralised, as the private key to the fee earning addresses is held by one person , so the distribution of earnings is prone to human error, it also dangerous to

Author: mobipoi#5774
Content: It like CEX but for Dex asset would have thought it was automated

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: Maybe in the future that might be a CC I don't know. But for now is sounds like the safest option

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: It was never a priority to automate as the distribution wasnt that often. I already read that @jl777c  would automate it once it would be more often. The problem I can imagine would be that you would need to convert all the fees to kmd in order to pay the dividend, dont know if itâ€™s possible to automate that part? Anyway everything is on the blockchain and I can imagine someone like jl has 100x more to lose should he run off with a mere 1m$ in dexfees... its just not worth it to f*ck around with that.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once there is enough DEX liquidity, then the dexfees for each coin can be autoconverted to KMD and with payments CC, it would be possible to automate the payouts. I guess if the DEX allowed to specify an arbitrary scriptPubKey to send the proceeds to, then it can all be automated. However, automating is a lot of work and there is no sense to do this until it becomes a real need. I have already distributed millions in revshares from the dPoW fees (most arrived during the BTC fee market). So yes, currently the DEX asset is a decentralized dexfees arriving, but centralized revshare distribution. Only the dexfees are at risk from jl777 gone bad

Content: if that happens, we can always update the DEX code to use a different address

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: mobipoi#5774
Content: Yes I agree , doesn't hurt to be paranoid once in a while but nice to know there are solutions already in place

Author: mobipoi#5774
Content: @Cryptoon  we should be better than binance

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: It was more in the sense of that the likelyhood of binance privkeys being compromised is a very super highly unlikely, just like it would that the DEX address should be compromised. Is it worth the time/effort to be the final 0.00000001% safe instead of just 99.9999999% even if the cost of that final 0.00000001 would be too high compared to the relative risk?
